Title: Nigeria needs $1b, 360,000 doctors to strengthen health system — ex-LUTH CMD
Summary: Former Chief Medical Director of Lagos University Teaching Hospital, Prof. Akin Osibogun said Nigeria needs at least $1 billion in urgent investment and 360,000 medical doctors to strengthen its health system . He made the comments during a visit to the hospital in Lagos .

Title: DSS arrests man for using social media to call for military coup
Summary: The suspect, identified as Innocent Chukwuma, was apprehended in the Oyigbo area of Rivers . He was arrested for using social media to call for a military takeover of the government .

Title: Another SAN withdraws from Mohbad’s DNA case—Wunmi claims
Summary: Another SAN withdraws from Mohbad’s DNA case—Wunmi Aloba claims . The widow of late Nigerian singer Ilerioluwa Aloba, popularly known as Mohbad, has said that another lawyer has withdrawn from the ongoing DNA case involving her son, Liam .

Title: EU, FG to host investment forum to boost local manufacturing, others
Summary: EU, FG to host investment forum to boost local manufacturing, others . EU Delegation to Nigeria and ECOWAS, in partnership with the Presidential Initiative for Unlocking the Healthcare Value Chain (PVAC) and the National Institute for Pharmaceutical Research and Development .

Title: First Lady reaffirms Nigeria’s commitment to ending TB by 2030
Summary: The First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, reaffirmed Nigeria’s commitment to ending tuberculosis (TB) by 2030 . She stressed that the sustainability of the country's TB response cannot depend solely on external assistance . Speaking as Special Guest of Honour at the 39th International Conference of the World Health Organisation .

Title: DSS arrests man who used own social media handle to canvass military coup
Summary: DSS arrests man who used own social media handle to canvass military coup . Posting on his "X" handle "@TheAgroman", Chukwuma stated that a coup was needed in Nigeria .

Title: New service chiefs arrive Senate for screening
Summary: New service chiefs arrive Senate for screening . They were sighted at the National Assembly Complex at 10a.m., accompanied by other senior military officers .

Title: Super Falcons coach Madugu gets contract extension after WAFCON qualification
Summary: Nigeria's spot in the 2026 WAFCON was confirmed despite the lacklustre draw . The 2026 tournament is scheduled to take place from March 17 to April 3 .

Title: Religious freedom thrives in Nigeria, minister insists
Summary: Religious freedom thrives in Nigeria, minister insists . “The perpetrators want to create that impression, but Nigerians know better,” he said .

Title: LG Expands AI Ecosystem: From Smart TVs to Connected Home Experiences
Summary: LG Electronics Nigeria reaffirmed its leadership in innovation with the successful hosting of the LG Smart TV AI Press Conference . The event, held at Ecobank Headquarters in Victoria Island, Lagos, brought together technology leaders, industry experts, and media representatives .

Title: PICTORIAL: Anambra AAC gov candidate stirs controversy over campaign photos
Summary: The African Action Congress candidate for the November 8 Anambra governorship election, Chioma Ifemeludike, is gaining significant attention online . She has shared a series of campaign photos and videos that spotlight her message of inclusive governance and challenge long-held patriarchal beliefs in politics .

Title: PICTORIAL: New service chiefs arrive Senate for screening
Summary: The newly appointed Service Chiefs arrived at the National Assembly Complex around 10 a.m. on Wednesday, accompanied by other senior military officers . Their appearance followed the Senate’s decision to bring forward the screening to Wednesday, October 29, reversing an earlier plan to hold it next week . Senate President Godswill Akpabio read

Title: FG, firm sign $400m deal to boost local steel production
Summary: Stellar Steel Company Limited is backed by Chinese parent groups Galaxy Group and RSIN Group . The deal was signed in Abuja between the Federal Ministry of Steel Development and Stellar Steel . It is one of the biggest foreign direct investment commitments in Nigeria’s steel sector in nearly a decade .

Title: UK deports asylum seeker sex offender after mistaken release
Summary: Hadush Kebatu, 38, had served the first month of a one-year sentence for sexually assaulting a teenage girl and a woman . He was re-arrested on Sunday following a nearly 48-hour-long manhunt by police . His high-profile case earlier this year in Epping, northeast of London,

Title: Experts to discuss ECOWAS' future, integration
Summary: The Amandla Institute for Policy and Leadership Advancement has announced plans to host a high-level meeting of experts in Abuja as part of activities marking the 50th anniversary of the Economic Community of West African States .
